group_1.textRight: Haaa...
Hmm, how to say it...
I've done some totally impulsive things that I regret,
but I feel like I haven't changed at all.

group_1.textCenter: I said I wanted to be a little devil@and signed up as a Magical Girl,
but it was this big spur of the moment thing@because I really admired the older girl next door,
so then when she went off to high school and@started keeping her distance from me,
my admiration came out to nothing...
After that I thought to myself, dang, I shouldn't@have become a Magical Girl on a whim like that.
Since then I've looked for new hype things,@got bored, found new stuff, got bored again...

group_1.textRight: Oh, hecks no!
I may have been having regrets on repeat,
but what makes me despair is that nothing's@changed.
...Seeing that Witch picture, it reminded me...
I'm actually just a dull girl@that was admiring someone else.
I get lonely, seeing everyone else change around me,@while I stay as this empty kid...
And yet I run a counseling center and hear@out everyone's problems. Isn't that crazy?
...But I'm glad I realized this!@[chara:300601:lipSynch_0][wait:1.2][chara:300601:cheek_0][chara:300601:face_mtn_ex_011.exp3.json:motion_100][chara:300601:lipSynch_1]This is a blessing for real!
I'm gonna change!
I'm gonna graduate from being that neighborhood@big sis I admired and find my own self!
...You know, I actually kinda knew.
I got to see my old neighbor and chat for the first@time in a while, and she'd gotten more mature,
but I wasn't sad about how she'd changed.
In fact, I was really excited about it!
I know that I'm an empty shell right now,
but someday I'll be able to show@her my all-grown-up self!

group_1.textLeft: It's not bad to have that kind of hope.
